marketNews.title: Trump Leads Quick Count, IHSG Pressured
marketNews.content: Donald Trump is projected to have secured more than 270 electoral votes and defeat Kamala Harris in the U.S. presidential election, according to the quick-count results released by Reuters, NBC News and The New York Times on Wednesday (6 Nov) local time. In general, Trump is proposing protectionist policies focused on domestic economic development, including: • Reducing the corporate tax rate to 15% (from the previous 21%). • Imposing import duties of 10-20% on all imported goods, with a 60% duty specifically on China. In response to the projected Trump victory, the U.S. dollar index (DXY) rose +1.32% to 104.8 on Wednesday (6 Nov). The 10-year U.S. Treasury yield rose +12 bps to 4.4%. In Indonesia, the news of Trump’s win pushed the rupiah down –0.6% to 15,840, the lowest level in three months. The 10-year Indonesian government bond yield rose +11 bps to 6.85%. The weakening also affected other emerging-market currencies, with the Malaysian ringgit down 1.3% and the Philippine peso down 0.58% on the day. Following the rupiah’s decline, Bank Indonesia’s Monetary and Securities Asset Management Director Fitra Jusdiman said the central bank is ready to stabilize the rupiah, planning a three-pronged intervention targeting the spot FX market, the domestic non-deliverable forward market and the secondary government-bond market.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: The key takeaway is that Trump’s protectionist policies could strengthen the U.S. dollar, which may negatively affect the IDX as foreign investors pull out, especially from companies with large dollar-denominated debt or import exposure. The policy could also dampen Indonesia’s economic growth, given the United States is Indonesia’s second-largest net export market. On the day of trading, Wednesday (6 Nov), foreign investors recorded an outflow of IDR 1.1 trillion, with major banks such as BMRI (-5.4%; outflow IDR 583 bn), BBNI (-5.1%; outflow IDR 132 bn) and BBRI (-2.3%; outflow IDR 480 bn) falling sharply. Companies with large dollar-denominated debt or import exposure also fell, including ICBP (-3.6%), PWON (-5.3%) and MAPI (-5.8%). The rupiah’s weakness narrows the space for Bank Indonesia to cut rates; Bloomberg forecasts a 25 bps rate cut by the end of 2024.

marketNews.title: Government to Issue New Provincial Minimum Wage Regulation
marketNews.content: Minister of Coordinating Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto said the government will issue a new regulation on provincial minimum wages (UMP) soon, aligning the UMP with the Constitutional Court’s decision that partially granted labor demands in the Cipta Kerja law. Once the UMP setting mechanism is defined, the government will amend Government Regulation No. 51/2023. The UMP setting period ends on 21 Nov 2024, with the announcement of district-level minimum wages due by 30 Nov 2024.

marketNews.title: BPI Danantara to Become Fourth-Largest Sovereign-Wealth Fund
marketNews.content: The head of the State-Owned Investment Agency Danantara, Muliaman Darmansyah Hadad, said President-elect Prabowo Subianto will inaugurate BPI Danantara as the new sovereign-wealth-fund manager on 7 Nov 2024. The fund is targeted to become the world’s fourth-largest sovereign-wealth fund with assets under management of USD 982 billion, starting with an initial USD 10.8 billion from the Indonesia Investment Authority.

marketNews.title: Government Prepares Incentives for Labor-Intensive Sector
marketNews.content: Minister of Coordinating Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto said the government is preparing incentives for the labor-intensive sector to prevent layoffs amid falling middle-class numbers and purchasing power. One incentive will be an investment-credit scheme allowing firms in the sector to purchase more efficient machines and increase output per unit.

marketNews.title: Eramet Indonesia Mining Begins Lithium-Brine Exploration in Central Java
marketNews.content: President Director of Eramet Indonesia Mining, Jérôme Baudelet, said the company has started a lithium-brine exploration study in Grobogan, Central Java, focusing on obtaining lithium-rich brine samples for electric-vehicle battery material.

marketNews.title: KADIN Committee Chief on Extending Export-Derived FX Placement
marketNews.content: Chairman of the KADIN Public Policy Committee Chandra Wahjudi said the proposed extension of the export-derived foreign-exchange placement deadline (DHE SDA) will reduce corporate liquidity. He hopes the government will add new incentives such as cheaper financing and larger tax reductions. The government is also considering extending the current 30 % DHE SDA placement requirement from the present minimum three-month period.

marketNews.title: Treasury Regulation No. 81/2024 on Core Tax System
marketNews.content: Finance Minister Sri Mulyani officially issued Treasury Regulation No. 81/2024 on core tax system implementation, covering taxpayer registration, tax payment and filing, effective 1 Jan 2025, and revoking 42 previous tax rules.

marketNews.title: Apple Proposes Nearly USD 10 Million Investment in Indonesia
marketNews.content: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ: AAPL) has submitted a proposal to invest nearly USD 10 million in Indonesia, targeting an accessories and component plant in Bandung, West Java, after the government barred sales of the iPhone 16 series for not meeting the 40 % local content requirement. The proposal follows Apple’s earlier commitment of IDR 1.5 trillion, below the IDR 1.7 trillion commitment.

marketNews.title: Government to Revise Provincial Minimum Wage Regulation
marketNews.content: Minister of Coordinating Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto said the government will issue a new regulation on provincial minimum wages (UMP) in the near future, aligning the UMP with the Constitutional Court’s partial approval of labor demands in the Cipta Kerja law. The UMP setting mechanism will be defined, after which the government will amend Government Regulation No. 51/2023. The UMP setting period ends on 21 Nov 2024, with district-level minimum-wage announcements due by 30 Nov 2024.

tickerNews.title: BMRI Experiences Large Foreign Outflow
tickerNews.content: Foreign investors recorded an outflow of IDR 1.1 trillion on Wednesday, with major banks such as BMRI falling 5.4% after a net outflow of IDR 583 billion; BBNI fell 5.1% after a net outflow of IDR 132 billion; and BBRI fell 2.3% after a net outflow of IDR 480 billion.

tickerNews.title: BBNI Records Foreign Outflow
tickerNews.content: Foreign investors recorded a net outflow of IDR 132 billion from BBNI, contributing to a 5.1% share price decline.

tickerNews.title: BBRI Records Foreign Outflow
tickerNews.content: Foreign investors recorded a net outflow of IDR 480 billion from BBRI, contributing to a 2.3% share price decline.

tickerNews.title: ICBP Shares Fall 3.6% on Dollar-Weighted Exposure
tickerNews.content: The company’s debt-and-import exposure led ICBP to fall 3.6% as the rupiah weakened.

tickerNews.title: PWON Shares Drop 5.3% on Rupiah Weakness
tickerNews.content: PWON’s shares fell 5.3% as the rupiah’s weakness hurt export-related revenue translation.

tickerNews.title: MAPI Shares Fall 5.8% on Margin Pressure
tickerNews.content: MAPI’s shares fell 5.8% as the rupiah’s weakness and higher input-costs weighed on margins, with the company’s gross-margin outlook - 20.5% in 3Q24 versus 26.9% in 3Q23 and 23.5% in 2Q24.

tickerNews.title: PTRO Wins Mining-Service Contract Worth IDR 4.03 trillion
tickerNews.content: Petrosea (ticker PTRO) secured a mining-service contract worth IDR 4.03 trillion with PT Bara Prima Mandiri and PT Niaga Jasa Dunia, to run until 31 Dec 2032, with an estimated 135.46 million bcm of overburden and 7.53 million tonnes of coal production.

tickerNews.title: Mayora Indah 3Q24 Earnings Call Highlights Margin Recovery
tickerNews.content: In the 3Q24 earnings call on Tuesday (5 Nov), Mayora Indah said the company is optimistic that gross-margin recovery will start in 4Q24 and become stronger in 1Q25 and 2Q25, driven by (1) a price increase implemented in October 2024, (2) a stronger USD-IDR exchange rate, and (3) a decline in raw-material costs as commodity prices fall. Gross-margin fell to 20.5% in 3Q24 versus 26.9% in 3Q23 and 23.5% in 2Q24, pressured by high coffee and cocoa costs and a weaker dollar. Management expects FY24 revenue growth of +12% on the back of a 20% YoY sales increase in October 2024 and a 17% YoY rise in 3Q24.

tickerNews.title: NCKL Announces Third RKEF Nickel Smelter to Start 1Q25
tickerNews.content: Head of Investor Relations at Trimegah Bangun Persada, Lukito Gozali, said the company’s third RKEF nickel smelter will start operations in 1Q25 with an initial capacity of 60,000 tonnes per year, expanding to 185,000 tonnes per year. The firm already operates two RKEF smelters with a total capacity of 120,000 tonnes per year and also runs two HPAL plants with a total capacity of 120,000 tonnes of nickel and 14,250 tonnes of cobalt per year.

tickerNews.title: FORU Share Sale Reduces IMR Asia Holding Stake
tickerNews.content: Fortune Indonesia’s controlling shareholder IMR Asia Holding Pte. Ltd. sold 1.55 million FORU shares at an average price of IDR 5 073 per share between 29 Oct and 4 Nov 2024, totaling IDR 7.8 billion. After the transaction, IMR Asia’s stake fell from 77.7% to 77.37%.

tickerNews.title: SCMA Announces Interim Dividend
tickerNews.content: Surya Citra Media announced an interim dividend of IDR 316.8 billion (IDR 5 per share). The dividend is payable on 14 Nov 2024 (record date) and will be paid on 6 Dec 2024. Based on the closing price of IDR 126 on 6 Nov, the implied dividend yield is about 4%.

tickerNews.title: ASSA Announces Interim Dividend
tickerNews.content: Adi Sarana Armada announced an interim dividend of IDR 73.8 billion (IDR 20 per share). The dividend is payable on 14 Nov 2024 and will be paid on 22 Nov 2024. Based on the closing price of IDR 725 on 6 Nov, the implied dividend yield is about 2.8%.

tickerNews.title: Heidelberg Materials Proposes Sunnira Ly as INTP President Director
tickerNews.content: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa (INTP) announced that its controlling shareholder Heidelberg Materials AG proposed a new director-candidate Sunnira Ly for the role of president director – the appointment will be discussed at the extraordinary general meeting on 4 Dec 2024.

tickerNews.title: NSSS Shareholder Transactions
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Nusantara Sawit Sejahtera bought 830 million NSSS shares at an average price of IDR 190, raising its stake to 24.55%; another transaction saw PT Mitra Agro Dharma Unggul sell 734.3 million shares at an average price of IDR 190, reducing its stake to 13.91%. Both transactions were disclosed on 29 Oct 2024.

tickerNews.title: Fast Food Indonesia (FAST) Closes 9 M 2024 and Cuts 2 274 k Employees
